comment: Professor Kretlow is a super sweet lady; her lectures can be a little boring, but it is clear that she cares for all of her students and wants them to succeed. She is always open to going back over material when students don't understand. Her tests were mostly based on old quiz questions and are on lockdown browser. I would 100% recommend!

Kretlow is incredibly kind, encouraging, caring, and easy to talk to. However, I found her lectures very boring and hard to sit through, and I wished content was covered faster. I did not feel completely prepared for the final, which is not just her fault, but we were still reviewing by the time most people were already done with the lab final

If you're taking CSE 1321 or 1322, you'd be making a huge mistake by not taking Professor Kretlow. Her lectures are all posted online, but if you decide to attend her class, she always does an amazing job teaching the material, gives out extra credit like candy, and always cracks jokes (please laugh at them, even if they're not that funny). 10/10

This professor was great! Made sure students understood what was going on and cared. 1 quiz every week. Midterm & final were the only tests which were mainly old quiz questions. Group project at the end of the semester. The lab was difficult (no coding experience prior) as you get further into the year but ended up getting a drastic curve.

Professor Betty is incredibly supportive and genuinely cares about her students' understanding. While her lectures aren't the most entertaining, she always puts in effort and shows up prepared. She's super sweet and approachable, and all her PowerPoints are available on the FYE website, which is really helpful. Definitely recommend!

shes so sweet.  i attended only a couple classes during the semester before i just stuck to reading the powerpoints on my own, and passed just fine.  but she always seemed so happy in class.  very kind to the students.

Ms.Kretlow truly cares for her students and is rooting for their success. She is willing to help students outside office hours. She repeats material for students who don't understand and she will ask questions before proceeding. As long as you study you will pass. Availability during office hours and always has a smile!

Professor Betty is a caring and supportive instructor. While her lectures may not be the most exciting, she provides helpful PowerPoints and video lectures, making it easy to review material at your own pace. The class is laid-back, and her genuine concern for students' success makes a big difference.

The lectures are not the most engaging, but they serve their purpose. Your grade mostly depends on the quizzes (usually given on Monday and due by Sunday), two tests (usually the questions are taken from the weekly quizzes), and one group project + the presentation of the project. Kretlow genuinely cares for her students and wants to help!

Took her class last Spring, was a free A but more importantly Prof. Kretlow might be one of the most caring professors out there. Really took her time to make sure her students understood the material and would never have a problem reexplaining concepts in class if anybody was confused. I'd take her again for any class if I could, absolute saint.

If you want an easy 'A' without learning anything than take this professor!!! But if you do prepare to teach yourself on topics she discuss in class. From my experience I learned more in the lab than in this class.
She is amazing! She genuinely wants her students to succeed and will do as much as she can to help you.

She was kind and accommodating but not the most easy to follow while attending her classes in person. Eventually I switched to mostly watching the lectures that had been made available online for all First-Year Experience students on my own time and I got an A with no issue.
this lady is amazing, beware is older and she sounds a little crazy at times but she is great at explaining the topics and giving you everything you need to suc

Prof. Kretlow is a kind and very knowledgeable lecturer; she has some interesting and humorous stories to tell too. I took her CSE1321 section - 8 quizzes, 2 tests, and a final. Up to 5 points overall if you go to the tutoring lab (0.5/session). Offers plenty of help before/after class if you need it - very communicative. You will enjoy this class!

Her lecturers are straighforward and quizzes are open note. She really does want students to pass the class. Though she does go off topic sometimes which can be a little irritating at times. Though I guess it keeps students engaged.

Mrs. Kretlow is very sweet and very laid back in her lectures. Her lectures are good but sometimes she does get carried away with things but she does cover the material well. QUIZES ARE EASY GRADES they are open everything she says she wants everyone get 100's on them. Well organized class all the notes are on one website WITH videos for EACH unit.

TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!!! SHE IS AMAZING!! This professor is amazing! She really wants you to do well and is willing to help you get there. The quizzes are open everything. She takes time to answer any questions you might have, in either her class or in a lab, and she uploads all of the things she codes in class to her Replit if you want to review it.

Kretlow really cares about her students. She will do anything in her power to help you succeed. She is always available outside of class and even on break. Material in her class is mostly focused on the slides. There is a textbook that can be used for reference. Quizzes and tests are average in difficultly. The class was organized well.

Mrs. Kretlow is a sincere, wholesome educator who is very passionate about her job. This was the second class I had with her and I received an A in both- she must be doing something right! 
My favorite thing about Betty is how encouraging and motivating she is towards students. She really sees the good in the world and wants everyone to succeed!

Professor Kretlow is one of the sweetest souls at KSU. The only reason I'm giving her a 4 rather than a 5 is that I could see how some students had a difficult time learning during lecture as she can go off on slight tangents at times and also can be hard to hear at times. Other than that, Professor Kretlow is amazing, right up there with Sullivan

I loved Prof. Kretlow, she knows what shes talking about, and if you get a chance to talk with her after class, I highly recommend it - she has a lot of advice and great stories about her career. If you are struggling in the lab, go to the atrium you'll get extra credit.
love her

Mrs. Kretlow is a kind and caring older woman. She does her best to make sure that her students are aware of common misconceptions / remind them of upcoming assignments' due dates. She is entertaining! She makes sure to review before an exam, and the reviews are worth your while. I recommend her!

super nice old lady. friendly face. She does move quite slowly, so I usually just watched the prerecorded lecture videos before class. The class is very easy, and she is very knowledgeable about the topics. Makes the lecture environment lighthearted w/ jokes. Wouldnt take her again, but couldnt get myself to rate this nice lady anything below a 4.

Ms. Kretlow was a good enough professor, but I wouldn't recommend her for students who have trouble sitting still without a lot of engagement from the teacher. She knows her stuff, but it's pretty crucial to pay attention, or at least read the textbook in order to pass.

Professor Kretlow is very knowledgeable in the material she is teaching. She has some good jokes and class always felt lighthearted and fun. She made sure to make us all aware of deadlines and what was expected of us at all times. On top of that, she did a thorough review for our test. She is a great professor and a very sweet woman!
I think she was a very lenient professor. I was too far behind though so I dropped the course. She is great though!

THE BEST! She is so kind and funny during her lectures. The only grades are weekly (sometimes biweekly) quizzes that are fairly easy. The exams are easy as long as you study and understand the powerpoints she goes over during class

The professor is super nice and makes it clear what the class requires from the student. She expects an understanding of the material rather well, with very little material overall (just the basics of computer science). Most of the lessons are using presentations that she gives access to online, meaning that all the lessons can be learned at home.

I have no idea if she's a good lecturer or not, but I thought the online class was terribly unorganized. Not difficult, but some assignments were extremely unclear for no reason. Didn't seem like she put much effort into them. That being said, this is a weed-out class and this might be the easiest section of it. (Taken in Java)

12 assignments with an accompanying quiz. 3 tests (including final). Quizzes and tests are easy. Assignments are incredibly confusing. And its not the subjects that are hard, they just make the assignments more confusing than they should be. I don't think this professor has any coding skills or hasn't coded in many years.

I took her for CS 4306 online. Her exams aren't difficult if you look through the slides, and she's willing to move back deadlines or give second chances on quizzes if the class is struggling. I'd take her again!

Honestly she's a great professor. The biggest complaint I have has nothing to do with her, but rather the outdated labs and assignments. Data Structures was a lab and a lecture that they combined (giving no set time for lab instruction). She really does care for the students and is willing to work with you to help. She's your best bet for CS3305.
Class wasn't hard. Just put in the time to complete all of your assignments and you'll be fine.
Angel

Decent teacher, however her class was sometimes unclear on what was being asked. She wasn't good with D2L. Lots of the class was just scraped from other database courses, so lots of the problems were online. This being said, she is a very caring person, and will work with you.

She is a very nice lady; she's really easy to talk to and cares that you're learning the material. However, as a result of her old age, she has a hard time using D2L and the quizzes and assignments are often incomprehensible. Great person, just not a very good professor if you want to actually understand what's being asked of you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Betty is so kind and truly cares about her students. She walks you through the assignments and will review the quizzes with you after you take them. Just try, listen and talk to her and you'll do fine in the class.

She is the most wonderful lady you can ever take for any class. She pretty much gives you everything you need to know either by lecture or resources, and if you need more time more than likely she will give it to you. She is very understanding of any circumstances and will listen to your request more often than not. Take her, but do study the mats.

Such a super sweet person. She loves chatting with her students. She has a good sense of when she thinks the class isn't understanding something and will explain it again. Algorithm Analysis in itself is kinda boring but she makes it interesting. Graded on Quizes(20%), HW(20%), and 2 exams(60%). If she sees you making real effort you will get an A.

EASY-going and knowledgeable. I don't want to say the class is EASY(C++ is very frustrating to learn), but she makes studying for her tests EASY. No curve-ball trick questions. Attendance is basically mandatory and she'll call you out for missing classes. The class builds on itself so make sure you keep up with the curriculum and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took her for Concepts of Programming Languages. The class was boring but she made it very simple and easy. Really flexible and understanding with assignments. Listens to students and has some interesting stories. You learn a lot. The only gripe I had was that the structure was weird since we ended up sharing d2l with another professor
